intro: Heliotropium nashii, commonly known as the Nash's heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling those of the common heliotrope. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Heliotropium nashii is often found in sandy soils and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance.
